info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 8:59PM CDT until May 10 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties.
West Fork Trinity River Near Jacksboro affecting Jack County.
Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Robertson and Leon Counties.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas...
South Sulphur River Near Cooper affecting Delta and Hopkins Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...West Fork Trinity River near Jacksboro.
* WHEN...From late Wednesday night to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding along the river reach is expected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 20.8 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING
